keywords.name: addLayers
keywords.description: Enable layer addition in snappyHexMesh

keywords.name: addLayersControls
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary controlling boundary layer addition in snappyHexMesh. Grows layers of cells from surfaces. Parameters: relativeSizes (thickness relative to local size), expansionRatio (growth rate), finalLayerThickness, minThickness, nGrow, nBufferCellsNoExtrude, nRelaxIter, nSmoothSurfaceNormals.

keywords.name: adjustTimeStep
keywords.description: Enable automatic time step adjustment based on Courant number

keywords.name: agglomerator
keywords.description: Agglomeration method for GAMG solver

keywords.name: alphatJayatillekeWallFunction
keywords.description: Thermal diffusivity (α_t) wall function using Jayatilleke's correlation. Accounts for varying turbulent Prandtl number near walls: α_t = ν_t/Pr_t, where Pr_t varies with y⁺. More accurate than constant Pr_t for heat transfer. Used for conjugate heat transfer and thermal boundary layers.

keywords.name: application
keywords.description: Solver application name to use for the simulation

keywords.name: backward
keywords.description: Second-order implicit backward time scheme (more accurate than Euler)

keywords.name: boundaryField
keywords.description: Boundary field specifications dictionary

keywords.name: bounded
keywords.description: Bounded variant of Gauss scheme that includes material time derivative term: Dϕ/Dt = ∂ϕ/∂t + ∇·(Uϕ) - (∇·U)ϕ. Third term helps maintain boundedness before convergence (∇·U=0). Used in steady-state cases to improve stability and convergence. Syntax: bounded Gauss <scheme>.

keywords.name: buoyantPimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for buoyant, turbulent flow of compressible fluids

Purpose: Transient buoyancy-driven flow
examples:
application     buoyantPimpleFoam;

// Applications: Natural convection, Fire dynamics, Indoor airflow

keywords.name: buoyantSimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Steady-state solver for buoyant, turbulent flow of compressible fluids

Purpose: Steady-state buoyancy-driven flow
examples:
application     buoyantSimpleFoam;

// Applications: Natural convection, HVAC, Fire simulation

keywords.name: cacheAgglomeration
keywords.description: Cache the agglomeration for GAMG solver (faster but uses more memory)

keywords.name: calculated
keywords.description: Boundary condition where values are calculated from other fields. Typically used for derived quantities like turbulent viscosity, where the boundary value is computed internally by the solver rather than being prescribed.

keywords.name: castellatedMesh
keywords.description: Enable castellated mesh generation in snappyHexMesh

keywords.name: castellatedMeshControls
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary controlling castellated mesh refinement phase in snappyHexMesh. Defines: features (edge refinement), refinementSurfaces (surface refinement levels), refinementRegions (volumetric refinement), locationInMesh (inside point), maxLocalCells, maxGlobalCells.

keywords.name: cavitatingFoam
keywords.description:
Transient cavitation solver based on homogeneous equilibrium model

Purpose: Cavitation
examples:
application     cavitatingFoam;

// Applications: Hydrofoils, Propellers, Pumps with cavitation

keywords.name: cellCoBlended
keywords.description: Cell Courant number based blending scheme. Automatically blends between two schemes based on local Courant number. High Co regions use stable scheme (upwind), low Co regions use accurate scheme (linear). Improves stability while maintaining accuracy.

keywords.name: cellLimited
keywords.description: Limited gradient scheme ensuring extrapolated face values remain within bounds of surrounding cell values. Coefficient (0-1): 1 = full limiting (guaranteed boundedness), 0 = no limiting. Essential for stability with poor quality meshes. Commonly used: cellLimited Gauss linear 1.

keywords.name: chtMultiRegionFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for conjugate heat transfer between solid and fluid regions

Purpose: Conjugate heat transfer
examples:
application     chtMultiRegionFoam;

// Applications: Heat exchangers, Electronics cooling, Multi-region thermal

keywords.name: coalChemistryFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for coal combustion with solid particles

Purpose: Coal combustion
examples:
application     coalChemistryFoam;

// Applications: Pulverized coal, Biomass combustion, Solid fuel

keywords.name: codedFixedValue
keywords.description: Dynamic boundary condition where values are computed on-the-fly using user-specified C++ code. The code is compiled at runtime. Useful for complex time-varying or spatially-varying boundary conditions that cannot be expressed with standard options.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this coded BC

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: C++ code to compute field values

keywords.name: CoEuler
keywords.description: Courant number based automatic time-stepping. Adjusts global time step to maintain specified maximum Courant number. Time step varies to keep Co ≤ Co_max. Useful for unsteady flows with varying velocity scales. Maintains stability while maximizing efficiency.

keywords.name: coldEngineFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for cold flow in internal combustion engines with mesh motion

Purpose: Engine cold flow simulation
examples:
application     coldEngineFoam;

// Applications: IC engine breathing, Intake/exhaust flow, Valve motion

keywords.name: compressibleInterFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for 2 compressible, isothermal immiscible fluids using VOF

Purpose: Compressible two-phase flow
examples:
application     compressibleInterFoam;

// Applications: Gas-liquid flows with compression, Underwater explosions

keywords.name: consistent
keywords.description: Enable consistent formulation (SIMPLEC for SIMPLE, consistent PIMPLE). Modifies pressure equation to improve coupling with momentum. Allows higher relaxation factors and faster convergence. Recommended for most SIMPLE simulations. Set to "yes" or "true".

keywords.name: corrected
keywords.description: Explicit non-orthogonal correction (most accurate for orthogonal meshes)

keywords.name: CrankNicolson
keywords.description: Second-order Crank-Nicolson time scheme with blending factor (0-1)

keywords.name: cubic
keywords.description: Third-order gradient or interpolation scheme using cubic polynomial. Higher accuracy than linear but requires high mesh quality. Appears in solidDisplacement and dnsFoam examples. More expensive computationally.

keywords.name: cyclic
keywords.description: Cyclic (periodic) boundary condition

keywords.name: d2dt2Schemes
keywords.description: Second time derivative (∂²ϕ/∂t²) discretization schemes sub-dictionary. Only Euler scheme is available. Used rarely for acceleration terms in solid mechanics.

keywords.name: ddtSchemes
keywords.description: Time derivative discretization schemes

keywords.name: deltaT
keywords.description: Time step size (seconds)

keywords.name: DIC
keywords.description: Diagonal Incomplete-Cholesky preconditioner for SYMMETRIC matrices. Efficient, commonly used with PCG solver. Better convergence than diagonal, more stable than FDIC.

keywords.name: DICGaussSeidel
keywords.description: Combined DIC/DILU preconditioner with Gauss-Seidel smoother. Used in GAMG solver. Balances accuracy and cost.

keywords.name: DILU
keywords.description: Diagonal Incomplete-LU preconditioner for ASYMMETRIC matrices. Standard choice for PBiCG/PBiCGStab solvers. Balances performance and stability.

keywords.name: dimensions
keywords.description: Physical dimensions [kg m s K mol A cd]

keywords.name: divSchemes
keywords.description: Divergence discretization schemes

keywords.name: dnsFoam
keywords.description:
Direct Numerical Simulation (DNS) solver for incompressible flow

Purpose: DNS turbulence
examples:
application     dnsFoam;

// Applications: Turbulence research, High-fidelity simulation

keywords.name: DPMFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow with Discrete Particle Method (Lagrangian particles)

Purpose: Particle-laden flow
examples:
application     DPMFoam;

// Applications: Spray, Pneumatic conveying, Droplet dynamics

keywords.name: driftFluxFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for 2 incompressible fluid phases using mixture model

Purpose: Drift-flux two-phase model
examples:
application     driftFluxFoam;

// Applications: Settling, Sedimentation, Dilute dispersed phase

keywords.name: dsmcFoam
keywords.description:
Direct Simulation Monte Carlo solver for rarefied gas dynamics

Purpose: Rarefied gas
examples:
application     dsmcFoam;

// Applications: Vacuum, High altitude, Molecular dynamics

keywords.name: electrostaticFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for electrostatics

Purpose: Electrostatic fields
examples:
application     electrostaticFoam;

// Applications: Electric potential, Charge distribution

keywords.name: empty
keywords.description: Empty boundary for 2D cases (no solving in this direction)

keywords.name: endTime
keywords.description: End time for the simulation (seconds)

keywords.name: engineFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for internal combustion engines with spray, combustion and heat transfer

Purpose: Engine combustion simulation
examples:
application     engineFoam;

// Applications: IC engines, Fuel injection, Engine combustion

keywords.name: epsilonWallFunction
keywords.description: Wall function for turbulent dissipation rate (ε). Calculates near-wall ε using law-of-the-wall: ε_w = C_μ^(3/4) * k^(3/2) / (κ*y), where y is wall distance. Used with k-ε turbulence models. Ensures proper dissipation in the boundary layer.

keywords.name: equations
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary within relaxationFactors for equation-level under-relaxation. Manipulates matrix coefficients before solving. Used in steady-state SIMPLE. Typical: U=0.7, turbulence fields=0.7. Higher α = faster convergence but less stable.

keywords.name: Euler
keywords.description: First-order implicit Euler time scheme (bounded, stable)

keywords.name: externalWallHeatFluxTemperature
keywords.description: Temperature boundary condition for external wall heat transfer. Supports three modes: (1) flux - specified heat flux, (2) power - specified power, (3) coefficient - convective heat transfer with h and T_ambient. Used for conjugate heat transfer and thermal simulations.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Heat transfer mode: flux | power | coefficient

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: Heat transfer coefficient [W/m²·K] for coefficient mode

keywords.name: fan
keywords.description: Cyclic boundary condition modeling a fan with pressure jump. The pressure jump is interpolated from a supplied fan curve (flow rate vs. pressure). Used to simulate fans, pumps, and other rotating machinery without explicitly meshing the fan blades.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Fan curve data file (flow rate, pressure rise)

keywords.name: FDIC
keywords.description: Fast Diagonal Incomplete-Cholesky preconditioner (DIC with caching) for SYMMETRIC matrices. Slightly faster than DIC. Use with PCG.

keywords.name: features
keywords.description: List within castellatedMeshControls specifying edge feature files (.eMesh) for refined snapping. Features are sharp edges extracted from geometry using surfaceFeatureExtract. Each entry specifies file and refinement levels.

keywords.name: fields
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary within relaxationFactors for field-level under-relaxation. Modifies field after solving: ϕ_new = α*ϕ_computed + (1-α)*ϕ_old. Used in steady-state SIMPLE algorithm. Typical: p=0.3, other fields via equations.

keywords.name: filteredLinear
keywords.description: Filtered linear central differencing scheme. Applies filtering to linear scheme: ϕ_f = linear + filter*(upwind - linear). Filter coefficient k (0-1) blends between linear (k=0) and upwind (k=1). Reduces oscillations while maintaining second-order accuracy.

keywords.name: fixedGradient
keywords.description: Boundary condition that sets a fixed gradient constraint: ∂ϕ/∂n = constant. The patch value is calculated from the gradient and adjacent cell values. Used for heat flux, velocity gradients, and other gradient-specified conditions.

parameters.name: gradient
parameters.description: Normal gradient value at the boundary

keywords.name: fixedNormalSlip
keywords.description: Slip condition with fixed normal component and zero tangential gradient. Normal component: U·n = fixedValue, tangential: ∂U_t/∂n = 0. Used for symmetry planes with known normal flow, permeable walls.

keywords.name: fixedPressureCompressibleDensity
keywords.description: Density boundary condition for compressible flows with fixed pressure. Calculates density from equation of state given pressure and temperature. Used at pressure inlets/outlets in compressible solvers.

keywords.name: fixedValue
keywords.description: Boundary condition that supplies a fixed value constraint. This is the base class for many other boundary conditions. The value is directly set and remains constant in time unless modified. Used at inlets with known values, walls with specified temperature, etc.
examples:
type            fixedValue;
value           uniform 0;  // Scalar field

type            fixedValue;
value           uniform (1 0 0);  // Vector field

keywords.name: flowRateInletVelocity
keywords.description: Velocity boundary condition that adjusts to match a specified mass or volumetric flow rate. The velocity profile is determined by the area-weighted average. Useful when total flow rate is known but velocity distribution can vary. Automatically handles non-uniform mesh face distributions.

keywords.name: FoamFile
keywords.description: OpenFOAM file header dictionary containing file metadata

keywords.name: freestreamPressure
keywords.description: Freestream pressure boundary condition for external aerodynamics. Automatically adapts between zeroGradient (subsonic outflow) and fixedValue (inflow) based on flow direction. Paired with freestream velocity condition. Used in wind tunnel simulations.

keywords.name: functions
keywords.description: Dictionary of function objects for post-processing and monitoring

keywords.name: GAMG
keywords.description: Geometric-Algebraic Multi-Grid solver. Solves on progressively coarser meshes, maps solution to finer mesh. Fast for large systems when coarsening cost < solving cost. Requires: smoother, nCellsInCoarsestLevel (default 10), agglomerator (faceAreaPair), cacheAgglomeration (true), nPreSweeps, nPostSweeps, nFinestSweeps, mergeLevels.

keywords.name: Gauss
keywords.description: Gauss integration scheme (requires interpolation scheme)

keywords.name: GaussSeidel
keywords.description: Gauss-Seidel smoother for smoothSolver or GAMG. Sequential cell-by-cell relaxation. Good general-purpose smoother.

keywords.name: geometry
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary in snappyHexMeshDict defining surface geometries for mesh generation. Supported types: closedTriSurface, distributedTriSurface, searchableBox, searchableCylinder, searchableSphere, searchablePlate. Geometries used for refinement, snapping, and region definition.

keywords.name: gradSchemes
keywords.description: Gradient discretization schemes

keywords.name: icoFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible, laminar flow of Newtonian fluids

Purpose: Laminar incompressible flow
examples:
application     icoFoam;

// Applications: Low Reynolds number, Microfluidics, Validation cases

keywords.name: inletOutlet
keywords.description: Generic inlet-outlet boundary condition. Applies zeroGradient for outflow (ϕ·n < 0) and fixedValue for inflow (ϕ·n ≥ 0). Prevents backflow issues at outlets while allowing reverse flow with specified inletValue. Commonly used for scalars at pressure outlets.

keywords.name: interFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for two incompressible, isothermal immiscible fluids using a VOF phase-fraction method

Purpose: Two-phase free surface flow
examples:
application     interFoam;

// Applications: Sloshing, Wave breaking, Dam break, Filling processes

keywords.name: interIsoFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for two incompressible, isothermal immiscible fluids using isoAdvector phase-fraction method

Purpose: Sharp interface two-phase flow
examples:
application     interIsoFoam;

// Applications: High accuracy VOF, Bubble dynamics, Droplet impact

keywords.name: internalField
keywords.description: Internal field initialization

keywords.name: interPhaseChangeFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for two incompressible fluids with phase change (evaporation/condensation)

Purpose: Phase change two-phase
examples:
application     interPhaseChangeFoam;

// Applications: Boiling, Condensation, Evaporation

keywords.name: interpolationSchemes
keywords.description: Interpolation schemes for face values

keywords.name: interstitialInletVelocity
keywords.description: Inlet velocity for porous media flows. Converts superficial velocity (based on total area) to interstitial velocity (based on void area): U_interstitial = U_superficial / porosity. Used in packed bed, porous media simulations.

keywords.name: kqRWallFunction
keywords.description: Wall function for turbulent kinetic energy (k), turbulence stress invariant (q), and Reynolds stress (R) fields. Provides appropriate near-wall treatment for k-ε and Reynolds stress models. Sets k to small non-zero value, enforces realizability for R.

keywords.name: laplacianFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for simple Laplace equation (e.g., thermal diffusion)

Purpose: Diffusion/Laplace equation
examples:
application     laplacianFoam;

// Applications: Heat conduction, Potential fields, Diffusion

keywords.name: laplacianSchemes
keywords.description: Laplacian discretization schemes

keywords.name: leastSquares
keywords.description: Second-order least squares gradient calculation using all neighbor cells. More accurate than Gauss linear on irregular meshes. Evaluates gradient by minimizing error at all neighbors. Computationally more expensive than Gauss.

keywords.name: LES
keywords.description: Large Eddy Simulation model settings

keywords.name: libs
keywords.description: List of shared libraries to load

keywords.name: limited
keywords.description: Limited non-orthogonal correction with coefficient (0-1)

keywords.name: limited corrected
keywords.description: Limited non-orthogonal correction for surface normal gradient. Applies partial correction: ψ controls limiting strength. ψ=0: uncorrected, ψ=0.33: correction ≤ 0.5×orthogonal part (stable), ψ=0.5: correction ≤ orthogonal part (accurate), ψ=1: full corrected. Use for max non-orthogonality 75-85°.

keywords.name: limitedCubic
keywords.description: Limited cubic interpolation scheme. Uses cubic polynomial with van Leer or Sweby limiting to prevent oscillations. Parameter (0-1) controls limiting severity. Higher order than linear but bounded. Good balance of accuracy and stability.

keywords.name: limitedLinear
keywords.description: Limited linear scheme. Applies limiting to second-order linear interpolation to ensure boundedness. The limiter coefficient (0-2) controls the amount of limiting. k=1 gives standard Van Leer limiter. Prevents over/undershoots while maintaining second-order accuracy.

keywords.name: limitedLinear01
keywords.description: Specialized limited linear scheme for scalar fields bounded between 0 and 1 (e.g., volume fraction α, flame regress variable b). Stronger limiting than standard limitedLinear to enforce 0-1 bounds. Coefficient typically 1.

keywords.name: limitedLinearV
keywords.description: Limited linear scheme specialized for vector fields. Calculates single limiter based on direction of most rapidly changing gradient, applies to all vector components. Stronger limiting than limitedLinear but more stable. Coefficient (0-1): 1 = strongest limiting.

keywords.name: linear
keywords.description: Second-order central differencing scheme. Linear interpolation between cell centers: ϕ_f = w*ϕ_P + (1-w)*ϕ_N, where w is based on distance. Non-diffusive and accurate but unbounded - can produce oscillations/overshoots. Use with caution for convection-dominated flows.

keywords.name: linearUpwind
keywords.description: Second-order upwind scheme reducing diffusion of pure upwind. Uses upwind cell gradient: ϕ_f = ϕ_U + ∇ϕ_U·d. More accurate than first-order upwind while maintaining stability. Popular for momentum advection. Naturally includes skewness correction.

keywords.name: linearUpwindV
keywords.description: Second-order upwind scheme specialized for vector fields. Single limiter calculated for all components based on most rapidly changing gradient. More stable than standard linearUpwind. Requires gradient scheme specification.

keywords.name: localBlended
keywords.description: Local cell-by-cell blending between two schemes using a blending factor field. Blending = scheme1*α + scheme2*(1-α), where α varies spatially. Enables adaptive schemes - e.g., upwind in shock regions, linear elsewhere. Requires creating blending factor field.

keywords.name: localEuler
keywords.description: Local time-stepping scheme for steady-state acceleration. Each cell advances with local time step based on local CFL: Δt_local = Co*Δx/|u|. Dramatically speeds steady-state convergence by 10-100x. Only for steady flows - not physical time-accurate.

keywords.name: locationInMesh
keywords.description: Point coordinate in snappyHexMesh castellatedMeshControls specifying which region to keep. Point must lie inside desired mesh region (not in refinement geometry cells). Cells not reachable from this point are removed. Also called insidePoint.

keywords.name: LUST
keywords.description: Linear-upwind stabilized transport scheme (blend of linear and linearUpwind)

keywords.name: magneticFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for electromagnetic fields

Purpose: Electromagnetic simulation
examples:
application     magneticFoam;

// Applications: Magnetic fields, Inductance

keywords.name: matchedFlowRateOutletVelocity
keywords.description: Outlet velocity condition matching mass flow rate from inlet patch. Ensures global mass conservation by adjusting outlet velocity uniformly to match inlet flow. Used when outlet velocity unknown but mass balance required.

parameters.name: inletPatch
parameters.description: Inlet patch name to match flow rate

keywords.name: maxAlphaCo
keywords.description: Maximum interface Courant number for multiphase flows

keywords.name: maxCo
keywords.description: Maximum Courant number for automatic time step adjustment

keywords.name: maxDeltaT
keywords.description: Maximum allowed time step (seconds)

keywords.name: maxIter
keywords.description: Maximum number of solver iterations

keywords.name: mergeLevels
keywords.description: Number of levels to merge in GAMG agglomeration

keywords.name: meshQualityControls
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary in snappyHexMeshDict defining mesh quality criteria. Checks: maxNonOrtho (non-orthogonality), maxBoundarySkewness, maxInternalSkewness, maxConcave, minVol, minTetQuality, minArea, minTwist, minDeterminant, minFaceWeight, minVolRatio, minTriangleTwist. Violations cause cell splitting or layer reduction.

keywords.name: minIter
keywords.description: Minimum number of solver iterations

keywords.name: mixed
keywords.description: Base class for mixed-type boundary conditions that blend fixed value and normal gradient: x_p = w*refValue + (1-w)*(x_c + ∇_⊥x/Δ). Weight field valueFraction (0-1) controls contribution. w=1 gives fixedValue, w=0 gives fixedGradient. Not usually applied directly - use derived conditions like inletOutlet.

keywords.name: momentumPredictor
keywords.description: Enable momentum predictor step in PISO/PIMPLE. When yes, solves momentum equation before pressure correction. Improves stability and convergence for most flows. Set to no only for very simple/low-Re flows or debugging.

keywords.name: movingMappedWallVelocity
keywords.description: Moving wall velocity mapped from another patch or region. Used for conjugate heat transfer with moving boundaries, FSI problems. Velocity obtained by sampling from specified patch.

keywords.name: movingWallVelocity
keywords.description: Moving wall velocity condition with specified wall velocity. Sets velocity equal to prescribed wall motion. Used for moving boundaries, sliding meshes, piston walls. Velocity can be uniform or spatially varying.

keywords.name: MPPICFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for incompressible flow with Multi-Phase Particle-In-Cell dense particles

Purpose: Dense particle flow
examples:
application     MPPICFoam;

// Applications: Fluidized beds, Particle collisions, Granular flow

keywords.name: MRFnoSlip
keywords.description: No-slip condition for walls in Multiple Reference Frame (MRF) zones. Accounts for rotating reference frame velocity when setting wall boundary. Used on stationary walls in MRF regions (e.g., casing around rotating impeller).

keywords.name: MRFPimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow with Multiple Reference Frames

Purpose: Transient multiple rotating regions
examples:
application     MRFPimpleFoam;

// Applications: Unsteady mixing, Rotor dynamics, Pumps

keywords.name: MRFSimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Steady-state solver for incompressible flow with Multiple Reference Frames

Purpose: Multiple rotating regions
examples:
application     MRFSimpleFoam;

// Applications: Multi-stage turbomachinery, Mixing tanks, Propellers

keywords.name: MRFslip
keywords.description: Slip condition for walls in rotating MRF zones. Used on rotating walls or symmetry planes within MRF region. Accounts for frame rotation when applying slip condition.

keywords.name: multiphaseEulerFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for multiple incompressible fluid phases with heat and mass transfer

Purpose: Multi-phase Eulerian flow
examples:
application     multiphaseEulerFoam;

// Applications: Multiple bubble sizes, Population balance, Mass transfer

keywords.name: multiphaseInterFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for n incompressible, isothermal immiscible fluids using VOF

Purpose: Multi-phase free surface flow
examples:
application     multiphaseInterFoam;

// Applications: Multiple immiscible fluids, Three or more phases

keywords.name: multivariateSelection
keywords.description: Groups multiple equation terms and applies single strongest limiter calculated across all terms. Ensures consistency when solving coupled equations (e.g., species transport + enthalpy). Calculates limiter once, applies to all fields.

keywords.name: MUSCL
keywords.description: Monotone Upstream-centered Scheme for Conservation Laws. Third-order TVD (Total Variation Diminishing) scheme with slope limiting. Achieves high accuracy with minimal oscillations. Uses van Albada limiter. Excellent for shock capturing and compressible flows.

keywords.name: nCellsInCoarsestLevel
keywords.description: Target number of cells in coarsest agglomeration level for GAMG

keywords.name: nCorrectors
keywords.description: Number of PISO pressure-velocity corrector iterations per outer loop. Each corrector solves pressure equation and updates velocity. Higher values improve accuracy but increase cost. Typically 2-3 for PISO, 1-2 for PIMPLE. Must be ≥1.

keywords.name: nFinestSweeps
keywords.description: Number of GAMG smoother sweeps at finest (original) mesh level. Default 2. Final smoothing pass for accuracy.

keywords.name: nNonOrthogonalCorrectors
keywords.description: Number of non-orthogonal mesh corrections for Laplacian terms. Each correction improves accuracy on skewed/non-orthogonal meshes. 0 = no correction (orthogonal mesh), 1-2 typical for moderately non-orthogonal, 3+ for highly skewed. Increases cost but improves solution on poor meshes.

keywords.name: nonNewtonianIcoFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible, laminar flow of non-Newtonian fluids

Purpose: Non-Newtonian laminar flow
examples:
application     nonNewtonianIcoFoam;

// Applications: Polymer flows, Blood flow, Rheology

keywords.name: nonuniform
keywords.description: Non-uniform field value (list of values)

keywords.name: noSlip
keywords.description: No-slip boundary condition for velocity (fixed to zero)

keywords.name: nOuterCorrectors
keywords.description: Number of outer corrector loops in PIMPLE algorithm. Controls how many times pressure-velocity system is iterated within each time step. 1 = PISO behavior (no outer iterations), >1 = iterative convergence like SIMPLE. Higher values allow larger time steps but increase computational cost.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Outer loops: 1 for PISO mode, 10-50 for iterative convergence

keywords.name: nPostSweeps
keywords.description: Number of GAMG smoother sweeps during refinement phase. Default 2. Controls smoothing as algorithm returns to finer meshes. Typically 2-4.

keywords.name: nPreSweeps
keywords.description: Number of GAMG smoother sweeps during coarsening phase. Default 0. Controls smoothing as algorithm moves to coarser meshes.

keywords.name: nSweeps
keywords.description: Number of smoother sweeps

keywords.name: nu
keywords.description: Kinematic viscosity (ν = μ/ρ) for incompressible flows. Dimensions [m²/s]. Viscosity of water ≈ 1e-6, air ≈ 1.5e-5 at 20°C. Higher values increase viscous dissipation and damping. Key parameter affecting Reynolds number Re = UL/ν.

keywords.name: nutkWallFunction
keywords.description: Wall function for turbulent kinematic viscosity (ν_t). Calculates near-wall turbulent viscosity using law-of-the-wall velocity profile. Ensures smooth transition between viscous sublayer (ν_t ≈ 0) and log layer (ν_t = κ*y*u_τ). Used at all wall boundaries in turbulent flows.

keywords.name: omegaWallFunction
keywords.description: Wall function for specific dissipation rate (ω = ε/k). Used with k-ω and SST turbulence models. Provides accurate near-wall behavior: ω_w = sqrt(k)/(C_μ^(1/4)*κ*y). More robust than ε near walls, making k-ω suitable for adverse pressure gradients.

keywords.name: orthogonal
keywords.description: Basic orthogonal surface normal gradient: (ϕ_neighbor - ϕ_owner)/d. Second-order accurate only when cell-cell vector is perpendicular to face. Recommended only for highly orthogonal meshes (max non-orthogonality < 5°). No non-orthogonal correction applied.

keywords.name: outletInlet
keywords.description: Inverse of inletOutlet: applies fixedValue for outflow and zeroGradient for inflow. Used when you want to specify values leaving the domain but allow natural conditions for reverse flow. Common for recirculation zones.

keywords.name: outletMappedUniformInlet
keywords.description: Inlet condition using uniform value mapped from outlet patch. Calculates average (or weighted average) at specified outlet, applies uniformly at inlet. Maintains mass balance for recirculation or periodic boundaries.

parameters.name: outletPatch
parameters.description: Name of outlet patch to sample

keywords.name: outletPhaseMeanVelocity
keywords.description: Outlet velocity for multiphase flows maintaining specified mean velocity in one phase. Calculates phase-weighted average velocity: U_mean = Σ(α*U*A) / Σ(α*A). Used in VOF to control liquid discharge rate.

keywords.name: overInterDyMFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for two-phase flow with overset meshes

Purpose: Two-phase overset
examples:
application     overInterDyMFoam;

// Applications: Ship hydrodynamics, Floating bodies, Wave-structure

keywords.name: overPimpleDyMFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow with overset meshes

Purpose: Overset (Chimera) meshes
examples:
application     overPimpleDyMFoam;

// Applications: Complex motion, Multiple bodies, Relative motion

keywords.name: partialSlip
keywords.description: Partial slip wall boundary condition with slip fraction. Blends no-slip and free-slip: U_parallel = (1-f)*U_adjacent, where f is valueFraction (0=free slip, 1=no slip). Used for rough walls or porous boundaries.

keywords.name: patch
keywords.description: Generic patch type

keywords.name: PBiCG
keywords.description: Preconditioned Bi-Conjugate Gradient solver for ASYMMETRIC matrices. Used when matrix includes advection terms. Less stable than PBiCGStab. Preconditioner options: DILU, diagonal, none.

keywords.name: PBiCGStab
keywords.description: Stabilized Preconditioned Bi-Conjugate Gradient solver for ASYMMETRIC matrices. More stable than PBiCG, recommended for advection-dominated problems. Preconditioner: DILU, diagonal, or none. Commonly used for velocity, turbulence fields.

keywords.name: PCG
keywords.description: Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient solver for SYMMETRIC matrices. Iterative method with preconditioning (DIC, DILU, FDIC, diagonal, none). Efficient for Laplacian-dominated equations. Set preconditioner, tolerance, relTol, maxIter.

parameters.name: preconditioner
parameters.description: DIC, DILU, FDIC, diagonal, or none

keywords.name: PDRFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for partially stirred reactor for engine combustion

Purpose: Explosion simulation
examples:
application     PDRFoam;

// Applications: Gas explosions, Vented explosions, Safety analysis

keywords.name: PIMPLE
keywords.description: Combined PISO-SIMPLE algorithm (pressure implicit splitting with semi-implicit method for pressure-linked equations). Outer iterations (nOuterCorrectors) achieve within-time-step convergence like SIMPLE, while inner PISO corrections (nCorrectors) handle pressure-velocity coupling. Enables larger time steps than pure PISO. Set nOuterCorrectors=1 for PISO mode, >1 for iterative convergence.

parameters.name: nOuterCorrectors
parameters.description: Outer SIMPLE-like iterations per time step (1=PISO, >1=iterative)

parameters.name: residualControl
parameters.description: Per-field convergence tolerance for outer iterations

parameters.name: momentumPredictor
parameters.description: Solve momentum predictor (yes for most cases)

parameters.name: turbOnFinalIterOnly
parameters.description: Update turbulence only on final outer iteration

keywords.name: pimpleDyMFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow with dynamic mesh motion

Purpose: Dynamic mesh
examples:
application     pimpleDyMFoam;

// Applications: Moving boundaries, FSI, Morphing geometry

keywords.name: pimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow using the PIMPLE (merged PISO-SIMPLE) algorithm

Purpose: Transient incompressible flow
examples:
application     pimpleFoam;

// Applications: Unsteady flows, Fluid-structure interaction, Moving meshes

keywords.name: PISO
keywords.description: Pressure Implicit with Splitting of Operators algorithm for transient flows. Iterates pressure-velocity coupling within each time step: momentum predictor → pressure solution → velocity correction (repeat nCorrectors times). Suitable for transient incompressible flows with small time steps. More efficient than PIMPLE for time-accurate simulations.

parameters.name: nCorrectors
parameters.description: Number of PISO pressure-velocity corrections per time step (typically 2-3)

parameters.name: pRefCell
parameters.description: Reference cell for pressure (if no fixedValue BC)

keywords.name: pisoFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow using the PISO algorithm

Purpose: Transient incompressible flow (DNS/LES)
examples:
application     pisoFoam;

// Applications: Direct numerical simulation, Large eddy simulation

keywords.name: pointLinear
keywords.description: Linear interpolation using point (vertex) values rather than cell values. Inverse-distance weighting from cells to vertices, then interpolates to faces. Reduces skewness error on tetrahedral and highly skewed meshes. More expensive than standard linear.

keywords.name: potentialFoam
keywords.description:
Potential flow solver for incompressible, inviscid flow

Purpose: Potential flow initialization
examples:
application     potentialFoam;

// Applications: Initial conditions, Inviscid flow, External aerodynamics

keywords.name: Pr
keywords.description: Molecular Prandtl number (Pr = ν/α = momentum diffusivity / thermal diffusivity). Dimensionless ratio characterizing relative importance of momentum and heat transport. Air ≈ 0.7, water ≈ 7. Affects thermal boundary layer thickness relative to velocity boundary layer.

keywords.name: preconditioner
keywords.description: Preconditioner for iterative linear solver

keywords.name: pRefCell
keywords.description: Reference cell index for pressure in closed incompressible systems. Sets absolute pressure level (pressure is relative). Typically cell 0. Used in SIMPLE/PIMPLE dictionaries.

keywords.name: pRefValue
keywords.description: Reference pressure value (Pa) at pRefCell in closed incompressible systems. Sets datum for relative pressure field. Typically 0 or atmospheric pressure.

keywords.name: pressureDirectedInletOutletVelocity
keywords.description: Inlet/outlet velocity condition with flow direction specified by inletDirection vector. Magnitude calculated from pressure. Used when flow direction known but velocity magnitude varies with pressure. Common for fan inlets with known flow angle.

keywords.name: pressureInletOutletVelocity
keywords.description: Velocity boundary condition for pressure-driven flows. At outflow (ϕ·n < 0): applies zeroGradient. At inflow (ϕ·n ≥ 0): applies fixedValue. Typically paired with totalPressure for the pressure field. Ensures velocity correctly responds to pressure-specified boundaries.

keywords.name: prghPressure
keywords.description: Static pressure for p_rgh field with adjustments for gravity: p_rgh = p_static - ρgh. Adjusts reference pressure for hydrostatic effects. Used at outlets in buoyancy-driven incompressible flows.

keywords.name: prghTotalHydrostaticPressure
keywords.description: Total hydrostatic pressure boundary condition for p_rgh = p - ρgh field. Used in buoyancy-driven flows with variable density. Specifies total pressure p0 = p_rgh + ρgh, solver computes p_rgh. Essential for incompressibleVoF and buoyantFoam solvers.

keywords.name: prghTotalPressure
keywords.description: Total pressure for p_rgh field: p0 = p_rgh + 0.5*ρ*|U|² + ρgh. Combines dynamic and hydrostatic pressure. Used at inlets/outlets in buoyancy-driven flows. Like totalPressure but for p_rgh instead of p.

keywords.name: printCoeffs
keywords.description: Print model coefficients to terminal

keywords.name: processor
keywords.description: Processor boundary for parallel decomposition

keywords.name: Prt
keywords.description: Turbulent Prandtl number

keywords.name: purgeWrite
keywords.description: Number of time directories to retain (0 = keep all)

keywords.name: QUICK
keywords.description: Quadratic Upstream Interpolation for Convective Kinematics. Third-order scheme using quadratic interpolation with two upwind and one downwind cell. More accurate than linearUpwind but can produce oscillations. Requires high mesh quality. Popular for structured meshes.

keywords.name: RAS
keywords.description: Reynolds-Averaged Simulation model settings

keywords.name: reactingFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for combustion with chemical reactions

Purpose: Compressible reacting flow
examples:
application     reactingFoam;

// Applications: Combustion, Chemical reactions, Premixed/diffusion flames

keywords.name: reactingParcelFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for compressible flow with reacting Lagrangian particles

Purpose: Reacting particle flow
examples:
application     reactingParcelFoam;

// Applications: Spray combustion, Droplet evaporation, Particle reactions

keywords.name: refinementRegions
keywords.description: Dictionary within castellatedMeshControls for volumetric refinement. Refines cells inside/outside/near regions defined by geometry. Modes: inside, outside, distance. Levels specified as (level) or distance table.

keywords.name: refinementSurfaces
keywords.description: Dictionary within castellatedMeshControls specifying refinement levels for each surface: level (min max) for cells near/intersecting surface. Higher level = finer mesh (level N divides cells 2^N times). Can specify patchInfo (boundary type).

keywords.name: relaxationFactors
keywords.description: Under-relaxation factors for stabilizing SIMPLE algorithm. Fields are updated: ϕ_new = α*ϕ_computed + (1-α)*ϕ_old, where α ∈ (0,1]. Lower values (0.3-0.7) improve stability but slow convergence. Equations relaxation applies to matrix coefficients. Essential for steady-state SIMPLE solvers.

keywords.name: relTol
keywords.description: Relative convergence tolerance for linear solver

keywords.name: residualControl
keywords.description: Convergence criteria for iterative solvers (SIMPLE/PIMPLE outer loops). When all field residuals drop below specified tolerances, outer iterations stop. Prevents unnecessary iterations and ensures solution quality. Supports regex patterns for multiple fields.

keywords.name: rhoCentralFoam
keywords.description:
Density-based compressible flow solver using central-upwind schemes

Purpose: High-speed compressible flow
examples:
application     rhoCentralFoam;

// Applications: Supersonic jets, Shock interactions, Explosions

keywords.name: rhoPimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for compressible flow using the PIMPLE algorithm

Purpose: Transient compressible flow
examples:
application     rhoPimpleFoam;

// Applications: Subsonic compressible flows, Heat transfer, Combustion

keywords.name: rhoSimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Steady-state solver for compressible turbulent flow using the SIMPLE algorithm

Purpose: Steady-state compressible flow
examples:
application     rhoSimpleFoam;

// Applications: Subsonic flows, Heat exchangers, Turbomachinery

keywords.name: rotatingWallVelocity
keywords.description: Rotating wall velocity for rotating reference frames. Calculates velocity from angular velocity ω and position: U = ω × r. Used for impeller blades, turbine rotors, rotating cylinders. Specify origin, axis, and rpm or omega.

keywords.name: runTimeModifiable
keywords.description: Enable runtime modification of dictionaries

keywords.name: scalarTransportFoam
keywords.description:
Solves a transport equation for a passive scalar

Purpose: Passive scalar transport
examples:
application     scalarTransportFoam;

// Applications: Tracer transport, Concentration, Age of air

keywords.name: SFCD
keywords.description: Self-Filtered Central Differencing. Applies filtering directly in the convection term to prevent oscillations. More stable than pure linear central differencing. Suitable for LES and unsteady flows where artificial diffusion must be minimized.

keywords.name: shallowWaterFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for shallow water equations

Purpose: Shallow water flow
examples:
application     shallowWaterFoam;

// Applications: Rivers, Coastal flows, Flood modeling

keywords.name: SIMPLE
keywords.description: Semi-Implicit Method for Pressure-Linked Equations. Iterative steady-state algorithm: solve momentum → solve pressure → correct velocity → repeat until convergence. Requires under-relaxation for stability. Standard algorithm for steady incompressible flows. More robust than PISO for steady-state.

keywords.name: simpleFoam
keywords.description:
Steady-state solver for incompressible, turbulent flows using the SIMPLE algorithm

Purpose: Steady-state incompressible turbulent flow
examples:
application     simpleFoam;

// Applications: External aerodynamics, HVAC, Industrial flows

keywords.name: simulationType
keywords.description: Turbulence simulation type

keywords.name: skewLinear
keywords.description: Linear scheme with skewness correction

keywords.name: slip
keywords.description: Slip boundary condition (zero normal gradient)

keywords.name: smoother
keywords.description: Smoother algorithm for GAMG or smoothSolver

keywords.name: smoothSolver
keywords.description: Solver using iterative smoother (GaussSeidel, symGaussSeidel, DIC, DILU, DICGaussSeidel). Specify smoother type and optional nSweeps (default 1). Good for moderately stiff problems.

parameters.name: smoother
parameters.description: GaussSeidel, symGaussSeidel, DIC, DILU, or DICGaussSeidel

keywords.name: snap
keywords.description: Enable snapping to surface in snappyHexMesh

keywords.name: snapControls
keywords.description: Sub-dictionary controlling snap-to-surface phase in snappyHexMesh. Moves mesh vertices to lie on surface geometry. Parameters: nSmoothPatch (smoothing iterations), tolerance (attraction distance), nSolveIter (displacement iterations), nRelaxIter (relaxation iterations), nFeatureSnapIter (feature edge snapping).

keywords.name: snappyHexMesh
keywords.description: Automatic split hex mesher. Refines hexahedral background mesh, snaps to surface geometry, and adds boundary layers. Three main phases: castellatedMesh (refinement), snap (surface fitting), addLayers (boundary layers). Configure in system/snappyHexMeshDict.

keywords.name: snappyHexMeshDict
keywords.description: Configuration dictionary for snappyHexMesh in system/ directory. Contains: geometry (surfaces), castellatedMeshControls (refinement), snapControls (snapping), addLayersControls (layers), meshQualityControls (quality checks).

keywords.name: snGradSchemes
keywords.description: Surface normal gradient schemes

keywords.name: solidDisplacementFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for solid mechanics (linear elasticity)

Purpose: Solid mechanics
examples:
application     solidDisplacementFoam;

// Applications: Structural analysis, Stress, Deformation

keywords.name: solidEquilibriumDisplacementFoam
keywords.description:
Steady-state solver for solid mechanics

Purpose: Equilibrium solid mechanics
examples:
application     solidEquilibriumDisplacementFoam;

// Applications: Static structural analysis

keywords.name: solver
keywords.description: Linear solver algorithm for equation system

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: PCG, PBiCG, PBiCGStab, smoothSolver, GAMG, diagonal

keywords.name: sonicFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for compressible flows with shock waves

Purpose: Supersonic/transonic flow with shocks
examples:
application     sonicFoam;

// Applications: Supersonic flows, Shock tubes, Nozzles

keywords.name: sprayFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for compressible flow with spray parcels

Purpose: Spray combustion
examples:
application     sprayFoam;

// Applications: Diesel spray, Fuel injection, Spray atomization

keywords.name: SRFPimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Transient solver for incompressible flow using Single Rotating Frame

Purpose: Rotating machinery (transient)
examples:
application     SRFPimpleFoam;

// Applications: Unsteady turbomachinery, Rotor-stator, Cyclic flows

keywords.name: SRFSimpleFoam
keywords.description:
Steady-state solver for incompressible flow using Single Rotating Frame of reference

Purpose: Rotating machinery (steady)
examples:
application     SRFSimpleFoam;

// Applications: Turbomachinery, Fans, Impellers

keywords.name: startFrom
keywords.description: Controls the start time of the simulation

keywords.name: startTime
keywords.description: Start time for the simulation (seconds)

keywords.name: steadyState
keywords.description: Steady-state (removes time derivative term)

keywords.name: stopAt
keywords.description: Condition for stopping the simulation

keywords.name: SuperBee
keywords.description: SuperBee TVD (Total Variation Diminishing) flux limiter. Very sharp limiter producing minimal diffusion and steep gradients. Can capture discontinuities well but may cause slight overshoots. Used in compressible flow simulations and shock-capturing.

keywords.name: surfaceNormalFixedValue
keywords.description: Fixed value in surface normal direction only. Specifies magnitude of velocity component normal to surface: U·n = refValue. Tangential components zero gradient. Used for uniform inflow perpendicular to curved surfaces.

keywords.name: symGaussSeidel
keywords.description: Symmetric Gauss-Seidel smoother (forward + backward sweep) for smoothSolver or GAMG. More stable than GaussSeidel. Preferred in OpenFOAM tutorials.

keywords.name: symmetry
keywords.description: Symmetry plane boundary condition

keywords.name: thermoFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for energy equation in stationary fluid

Purpose: Pure heat transfer
examples:
application     thermoFoam;

// Applications: Heat conduction, Thermal analysis

keywords.name: timeFormat
keywords.description: Format for time directory names

keywords.name: timePrecision
keywords.description: Number of significant figures for time directory names

keywords.name: tolerance
keywords.description: Absolute convergence tolerance for linear solver

keywords.name: totalPressure
keywords.description: Boundary condition specifying total (stagnation) pressure: p_total = p_static + 0.5*ρ*|U|². Used at inlets/outlets where total pressure is known. The static pressure is calculated from total pressure minus dynamic pressure. Essential for compressible flows and fan boundaries.

keywords.name: transportModel
keywords.description: Transport/viscosity model selection

keywords.name: turbOnFinalIterOnly
keywords.description: Solve turbulence equations only on final outer corrector iteration. Reduces computational cost by skipping turbulence updates in intermediate iterations. Useful when turbulence changes slowly. May impact convergence for strongly coupled turbulent flows.

keywords.name: turbulentIntensityKineticEnergyInlet
keywords.description: Calculates turbulent kinetic energy (k) from turbulence intensity and mean velocity: k = 1.5*(I*|U|)², where I is intensity (typically 0.01-0.1). Simplifies turbulence specification at inlets when intensity is known from experiments or empirical data.

keywords.name: turbulentMixingLengthDissipationRateInlet
keywords.description: Calculates turbulent dissipation rate (ε) from mixing length: ε = C_μ^(3/4) * k^(3/2) / l_m. The mixing length typically scales with geometry (e.g., 0.07*hydraulic_diameter). Used with turbulentIntensityKineticEnergyInlet for complete turbulence inlet specification.

keywords.name: twoPhaseEulerFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for a system of 2 incompressible fluid phases with heat transfer

Purpose: Eulerian two-phase flow
examples:
application     twoPhaseEulerFoam;

// Applications: Bubbly flow, Fluidization, Sedimentation

keywords.name: type
keywords.description: Boundary condition type or patch type

keywords.name: uncorrected
keywords.description: No non-orthogonal correction (for highly non-orthogonal meshes)

keywords.name: uniform
keywords.description: Uniform field value (same everywhere)

keywords.name: uniformFixedValue
keywords.description: Fixed value boundary condition with time-varying uniform value. Uses Function1 to specify value that can change in time: constant, table, polynomial, sine, square, etc. More flexible than fixedValue for transient conditions.

keywords.name: upwind
keywords.description: First-order upwind scheme. Uses upwind cell value: ϕ_f = ϕ_upwind. Guarantees boundedness but highly diffusive. Suitable for initial simulations or highly convection-dominated flows. Taylor series shows it adds artificial diffusion proportional to u*Δx/2, smearing sharp gradients.

keywords.name: value
keywords.description: Value specification for boundary condition or initial field

keywords.name: vanAlbada
keywords.description: Van Albada flux limiter scheme. Smooth TVD (Total Variation Diminishing) limiter with good compromise between accuracy and stability. Less compressive than SuperBee, less diffusive than Van Leer. Used for scalar transport.

keywords.name: vanLeer
keywords.description: Van Leer TVD limiter scheme. Classic flux limiter providing smooth limiting without oscillations. Less compressive than SuperBee but more robust. Excellent general-purpose scheme for convection. Works well for scalar transport.

keywords.name: variableHeightFlowRate
keywords.description: Velocity inlet maintaining specified volumetric flow rate with variable liquid height. Used in VOF simulations with partially filled inlets. Adjusts velocity based on liquid fraction to maintain constant Q = U*A*α.

keywords.name: wall
keywords.description: Wall patch type

keywords.name: waveAlpha
keywords.description: Volume fraction (alpha) boundary condition for wave simulations. Sets phase indicator field consistent with wave profile from waveSuperposition. Used in multiphase VOF solvers with free surface waves.

keywords.name: waveSurfacePressure
keywords.description: Pressure boundary condition at free surface for wave simulations. Calculates pressure from wave elevation and acceleration. Coupled with waveVelocity and waveAlpha conditions. Requires wave superposition to be defined.

keywords.name: waveVelocity
keywords.description: Wave velocity boundary condition for free surface flows. Sets velocity from superposition of wave models (Airy, Stokes, etc.) defined in waveSuperposition class. Used at wave generation boundaries. Requires libwaves.so library. Automatically handles inlet/outlet switching.

keywords.name: wedge
keywords.description: Wedge boundary for axisymmetric cases

keywords.name: writeCompression
keywords.description: Enable compression for output files

keywords.name: writeControl
keywords.description: Controls when results are written to disk

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: timeStep, runTime, adjustableRunTime, cpuTime, or clockTime

keywords.name: writeFormat
keywords.description: Format for writing results

keywords.name: writeInterval
keywords.description: Interval for writing results (depends on writeControl)

keywords.name: writePrecision
keywords.description: Number of significant figures for ASCII output

keywords.name: XiFoam
keywords.description:
Solver for premixed turbulent combustion using b-Xi model

Purpose: Premixed combustion
examples:
application     XiFoam;

// Applications: Gas turbines, Premixed flames, Flame speed

keywords.name: zeroGradient
keywords.description: Applies a zero-gradient condition from the patch internal field onto the patch faces. The normal gradient at the boundary is zero: ∂ϕ/∂n = 0. Commonly used at outlets, symmetry planes, and walls for pressure. The patch value equals the adjacent cell value.
